children.name: clothes
children.definition: things that you wear, for example coats, shirts, and dresses: quần áo
examples: What sort of clothes was he wearing?
He was still in his work clothes.
a clothes shop
Grammar
Clothesis a plural noun and has no singular form :
He needed some new clothes (NOT a new clothe/clothes).
a change of clothesa set of clothes as well as the ones that you are wearing: đồ để thay
You'll need a change of clothes if you're staying overnight.
He only took a small bag with a change of clothes.
baby clothesa shop for baby clothes

children.name: wear clothes
examples: She always wears beautiful clothes.

children.name: be dressed in … clothes
examples: The man was dressed in ordinary clothes.

children.name: put your clothes on
examples: I told him to get up and put some clothes on.

children.name: take off/remove your clothes
examples: She took off her clothes and slipped into bed.

children.name: change your clothes
examples: I usually change my clothes as soon as I get home from work.

children.name: warm clothes
examples: If you’re walking in the mountains, take plenty of warm clothes.

children.name: casual clothes
examples: Most people feel more comfortable in casual clothes.

children.name: evening clothes
examples: I don’t often have a chance to wear formal evening clothes.

children.name: designer clothes
children.definition: made by a well-known designer
examples: She spends hundreds of pounds on designer clothes.

children.name: sb’s best clothes
examples: They wore their best clothes for the photograph.

children.name: formal clothes
examples: It’s best to wear formal clothes for an interview.

children.name: school/work clothes
examples: Work clothes tend to be black, blue, or grey.

children.name: sports clothes
examples: Lou was wearing sports clothes and sunglasses.

children.name: ordinary/everyday clothes
examples: Everyone else was wearing ordinary clothes.

children.name: civilian clothes
children.definition: ordinary clothes rather than a military uniform
examples: a US army lieutenant in civilian clothes

children.name: maternity clothes
children.definition: for women who are having a baby

children.name: winter/summer clothes
examples: The shops are already full of winter clothes.

children.name: plain clothes
children.definition: ordinary clothes that the police wear in order not to be recognized
examples: He was arrested by officers in plain clothes.

children.name: clean clothes
examples: I had no clean clothes.

children.name: dry clothes
examples: You’d better change into dry clothes or you’ll get cold.

children.name: fashionable/trendy clothes
examples: The club was full of beautiful people wearing trendy clothes.

children.name: elegant
examples: Italian people are often admired for their elegant clothes.

children.name: old-fashioned
examples: I decided to throw out all my old-fashioned clothes.

children.name: smart
examples: British English Do you have to wear smart clothes to work?

children.name: scruffy
children.definition: dirty and untidy
examples: She was poor and dressed in scruffy clothes.

children.name: second-hand clothes
children.definition: not new
examples: Charity shops sell second-hand clothes at low prices.

children.name: dowdy
children.definition: unfashionable and unattractive
examples: Dowdy clothes make you have less confidence in yourself.

children.name: clothing
children.definition: clothes ingeneral- use this either to talk about aparticulartypeof clothes, or to talk about alargequantityof clothes. Also used in some phrases: quần áo, đồ
examples: basic necessities such as food and clothing
She took only a few items of clothing.
sports clothing
winter/summer clothing
a clothing manufacturera large clothing manufacturer

children.name: warm clothing
examples: The flood victims need shelter and warm clothing.

children.name: light clothing
children.definition: made from thin materials
examples: You’ll only need light clothing during the day.

children.name: outdoor clothing
examples: The shop sells ski-wear and other outdoor clothing.

children.name: protective clothing
examples: Laboratory technicians have to wear special protective clothing.

children.name: waterproof clothing
examples: Always take a map, a compass, and waterproof clothing.

children.name: outer clothing
children.definition: that you wear over other clothes
examples: The men were hastily pulling on some outer clothing.

children.name: designer clothing
children.definition: made by a well-known designer

children.name: a piece of clothing
examples: There were pieces of clothing scattered around the room.

children.name: an item/article of clothingformal
children.definition: a piece of clothing
examples: All items of clothing should be clearly labelled.

children.name: a layer of clothing
examples: In very cold weather it’s good to wear several layers of clothing.

children.name: a change of clothing
examples: I tooka change of clothingwith me.

children.name: the clothing industry
examples: There are plenty of job opportunities in the clothing industry.

children.name: sth to wear
children.definition: sth/anything/nothing to wearspokenclothes, especially clothes for aparticularevent or occasion:
examples: I must buy something to wear at Julie’s wedding.
You’re always saying you have nothing to wear, but you’ve got a whole closet full of clothes.
I can’t find anything to wear!

children.name: garment
children.definition: a single piece of clothing. Also used when talking about buying and selling clothes: món đồ, quần áo

children.name: a long velvet garment
examples: Only two garments may be taken into the changing room.

children.name: garment workers/factories
examples: The garment industry has grown by 20% in this area in the past five years.

children.name: wardrobe
children.definition: all the clothes that you own or all the clothes that you wear at a particular time of year - used especially by people whowriteaboutfashionor by people whosellclothes: tủ đồ
examples: Her wardrobe consisted mainly of smart clothes for work.
We have everything you need to update your business wardrobe.
Enter our simple fashion quiz and win a whole new wardrobe.
You could win a complete new wardrobe!
winter/summer etcwardrobethe clothes you have that are suitable to wear in the winter, summer etc :

children.name: By adding a few bright buttons or belts to your old clothes you can have a new summer wardrobe
examples: I will need a new summer weardrobe.

children.name: gear
children.definition: clothes for a particular sport or activity: đồ, quần áo
examples: She was wearing her running gear.
Have you got all your gear?
Bring your rain gear.

children.name: clothes used to belong to sb else
cast-offs
children.definition: / castoffs clothes that you no longer wear and give to sb else: đồ cũ, đồ đi cho
examples: I’m not interested in wearing other people’s castoffs.
Our mother kept a box of old castoffs and we spent hours dressing up, pretending to be princesses or pirates.
cast-off[attri]
castoff clothes and shoes

children.name: hand-me-down
children.definition: a piece of clothing that is given to ayoungerchildin a family when their older brother or sister has grown too big for them or stopped wearing them: đồ cũ , đồ để lại (được anh chị để lại)
examples: The youngest child in the family usually gets all the hand-me-downs.
This sweater is a hand-me-down from my sister, but I love it.

children.name: tailor
children.definition: sb who makes men’s clothes, that are measured to fit each customer perfectly as a job.: thợ mayđồ nam

children.name: costumier
children.definition: /costumerUS a person who makes and rents out costumes, especially for use in a theatre: người cho thuê y phục sân khấu

children.name: a theatrical costumier
examples: We have tried local theatrical costumiers but no one has exactly the right period.
The costumer does not let them down.

children.name: dressmaker
children.definition: sb who makes women's clothes, especially as a job: thợ may đồ nữ
examples: dressmaking[U]

children.name: wear
children.definition: Don’t usewearon its own, used about types of clothes sold in a shop: đồ mặc, quần áo
examples: evening/casual/sports/children’s etc wear
a shop that specializes in evening wear
You’ll find a nice range of silk ties in the menswear department on the fourth floor.
The company’s line of casual wear is primarily sold in large discount chain stores.
menswear/ womenswear[U] clothing for men or women – used especially in shops :y phục nam giới, y phụcnữ
the menswear department
knitwear[U] clothes made by connecting wool or another type of thread into joined rows đồ đan,hàng dệt kim
leisure wear[U] clothes that are worn for relaxing in

children.name: dress
children.definition: Don’t usedresson its own: used in combination, to refer to clothes of a particular type, especially those worn in particular situations:quần áo, đồ
examples: Casual dress is not appropriate for an interview.

children.name: evening dressspecial clothing worn for formal events, such as special evening meals : quầnáo dạ hội,lễ phục
examples: The invitation says to wear evening dress.

children.name: men in evening dress
examples: The queen, in full ceremonial dress, presided over the ceremony.

children.name: suit
children.definition: a set of clothes or a piece of clothing to be worn in a particular situation or while doing a particular activity: bộ đồ, món đồ
examples: a bathing/jogging etc suit
a diving/protective/ski etc suit
a swimsuit/ spacesuit
a suitofarmour

children.name: lining
children.definition: a piece of material that covers the inside of something, especially a piece of clothing: lớp vải lót trong
examples: a jacket with a silk lining
leather gloves with fur linings

children.name: rags
children.definition: clothes that are old and torn: quần áo ráchrưới

children.name: in rags
examples: an old man dressedinrags.
Their clothes wereinrags (= torn) .
